Name: shriver_yr_gridSTDF_historical
var_description: Historical Probability of Sagebrush Seeding Success
var_comment: Based on Shriver, R.K. et al.  (2018). Adapting management to a changing world: Warm temperatures, dry soil, and inter-annual variability limit restoration success of dominant woody shrub in temperate drylands. Global Change Biology. 24
var_comment2: Historical climate data (1991 - last year) is run through Soilwat. Results are used to generate probabilities of seeding success in previous years, based upon the model presented in Shriver et al. 2018.
var_cell_methods: time: mean within days time: mean over years

Name: shriver_yr_gridSTDF_prediction
var_description: Future Sagebrush Seeding Success for the current year and next year (for 30 realizations of T&P anomalies)
var_comment: Based on Shriver, R.K. et al.  (2018). Adapting management to a changing world: Warm temperatures, dry soil, and inter-annual variability limit restoration success of dominant woody shrub in temperate drylands. Global Change Biology. 24
var_comment2: 30 realizations of the current year are generated via multivariate sampling based upon by NWS 'long-lead forecasts'  anomalies for temperature and precipitation. These realizations are run through Soilwat.   Results are used to generate probabilities of seeding success in the current and next year, based upon the model presented in Shriver et al. 2018.
var_cell_methods: time: mean within days time: mean over years

Name: GISSM_yr_gridSTDF_historical
var_standardname: probability (frequency) of years when big sagebrush seedlings survive in undisturbed natural vegetation
var_description: Historical Mean Establishment
var_comment: Based on Schlaepfer, D. R. et al. (2014). Modeling regeneration responses of big sagebrush (Artemisia tridentata) to abiotic conditions. Ecological Modelling. 286 https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ecolmodel.2014.04.021
var_comment2: Historical climate data (1991 - last year) is run through Soilwat. Results are the probability (frequency) of years when big sagebrush seedlings survive in undisturbed natural vegetation
var_cell_methods: time: mean within days time: mean over years

Name: GISSM_yr_gridSTDF_prediction
var_standardname: probability (frequency) of years when big sagebrush seedlings survive in undisturbed natural vegetation
var_description: Future Establishment Probability for the current year and the next year (for 30 realizations of T&P anomalies)
var_comment: Based on Schlaepfer, D. R. et al. (2014). Modeling regeneration responses of big sagebrush (Artemisia tridentata) to abiotic conditions. Ecological Modelling. 286 https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ecolmodel.2014.04.021
var_comment2: 30 realizations of the current year are generated via multivariate sampling based upon by NWS 'long-lead forecasts'  anomalies for temperature and precipitation. These realizations are run through Soilwat. Results represent the probability (frequency) of realization of the current and next year when big sagebrush seedlings survive in undisturbed natural vegetation.
var_cell_methods: time: mean within days time: mean over years
